Description: Gold ear-ring; a wire ring fastened with a loop, attached to which is a circular cloisson setting for a stone (now missing) surrounded by cable border of twisted wire; below is a pendant bead suspended on a plain wire.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (2542)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.118, Tomb 66)
Laffineur et al. 1986 / Amathonte III. Testimonia 3. L'Orfèvrerie. Scarabées, scaraboïdes et cônes. La coupe en argent du British Museum (No. 91, p.28 & fig.24)
